statements.name: PROC CAS
statements.description: Enables you to program and schedule SAS Cloud Analytic Services actions from the SAS client.

statements.name: ACTION
statements.description: Runs SAS Cloud Analytic Services actions.

statements.name: CALL
statements.description: Calls a function with the specified argument. If the function returns a value, it is ignored.

statements.name: CONTINUE
statements.description: Stops processing the current DO loop iteration and resumes with the next iteration.

statements.name: DEFAULT
statements.description: Enables you to control how CASL returns action results and action processing status.

statements.name: DELETE
statements.description: Deletes the specified value from memory.

statements.name: DESCRIBE
statements.description: Enables you to view the structure and data type of CASL variables and expressions.

statements.name: DO
statements.description: Creates a block of code that executes as one statement.

statements.name: DO OVER
statements.description: Iterates over an array, dictionary, or table.

statements.name: DO UNTIL
statements.description: Executes statements in a DO loop repetitively until a condition is true.

statements.name: DO WHILE
statements.description: Executes statements in a DO loop repetitively while a condition is true.

statements.name: ELSE
statements.description: If the expression specified by an IF statement results in a false value, the statement immediately after the ELSE statement is executed.

statements.name: END
statements.description: Ends a DO group, FUNCTION, or SELECT group processing.

statements.name: ENDEXTERNALSOURCE
statements.description: Marks the end of the EXTERNALSOURCE statement.

statements.name: ENDSOURCE
statements.description: Marks the end of the SOURCE statement.

statements.name: EXIT
statements.description: Exits the current block of CASL code.

statements.name: EXTERNALSOURCE
statements.description: Enables you to embed text in the program as a block of code and then assign the code to a given variable.

statements.name: FILE
statements.description: The FILE statement changes the default output location for the PRINT statement. You can choose to write the output to an external file, the log, or ODS.

statements.name: FNC
statements.description: Lists all common functions by name and category with simple descriptions.

statements.name: FORMAT
statements.description: Associates a format with a single variable or a list of variables.

statements.name: FUNCTION
statements.description: Creates a new function that can be called in an expression.

statements.name: FUNCTIONLIST
statements.description: Lists all CASL built-in functions and user defined functions by name with simple descriptions.

statements.name: GLOBAL
statements.description: Creates a variable that can be accessed and used anywhere within a CASL program.

statements.name: GOTO
statements.description: Transfers execution immediately to a labeled statement.

statements.name: IF
statements.description: Conditionally executes a statement based on the value of an expression.

statements.name: Label
statements.description: Specifies a label target for the GOTO statement. No semicolon is required.

statements.name: LEAVE
statements.description: Stops processing the current loop and resumes with the next statement in the sequence.

statements.name: LOADACTIONSET
statements.description: Loads a SAS Cloud Analytic Services action set.

statements.name: LOCAL
statements.description: Creates a variable that is local to a CASL function.

statements.name: Null
statements.description: A statement that performs no operation.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: Sets the active output location.

statements.name: PRINT
statements.description: Writes the values of constants, variables, and expressions to the current output location.

statements.name: PRINTLST
statements.description: Prints to the listing file defined by the application. If the value is a list, the list will be transverse and each item will be displayed. If the item is a table, it will be printed to the current output location.

statements.name: RETURN
statements.description: Returns a value from the current function.

statements.name: RUN
statements.description: Executes the previously entered SAS statements.

statements.name: SAVERESULT
statements.description: Saves a result table in the variable in the form specified.

statements.name: SELECT
statements.description: Executes one of several statements or groups of statements.

statements.name: SESSION
statements.description: Specifies a session to use for actions invoked by the program.

statements.name: SET
statements.description: Controls options that modify some behaviors of CAS actions and controls corresponding messages from the SAS log.

statements.name: SOURCE
statements.description: Enables you to embed text in the program and assign it to a given variable.

statements.name: UNSET
statements.description: Turns off options that modify some behaviors of CAS actions and suppresses corresponding messages in the SAS log.

statements.name: UPLOAD
statements.description: Transfers a file from the SAS client to the server. After data transfer, the server loads the data into an in-memory table.
